title: Identifier
description: Unique internal identifier for the social investment deal.

title: Title
description: A title for the deal. Ideally, this is concise and under 140 characters.

title: Status
description: Current status of the social investment deal: in progress, an open investment, closed without funds being drawn down, closed without core funds being approved. Use the status codelist.

title: Deal date
description: The year (YYYY) or year-month (YYYY-MM) combination in which this deal should be counted. For a blended finance deal this should be the date of financial close. For other deals, this should be the date at which the most significant component was confirmed. Data analysts should be aware that components of a deal may each have their own significant dates.

title: Currency
description: The default currency for the deal. All values within the deal are assumed to be in this currency unless otherwise stated. Use GBP for £

title: Estimated deal value
description: The total estimated value of this deal. This should be based on the **optimum** fund raising targets where these are available. In cases where a range if presented, the mid-point should be used. The estimated deal value may be based on documents, and does not necessarily match the sum of the values of the investments components of this deal recorded in this dataset.

title: Confirmed deal value
description: The total value of this deal based on confirmed funds raised.

title: Recipient Organization
description: The Organization in receipt of the finances from the social investment deal.

title: Name
description: Organization name

title: Identifier
description: A globally unique identifier for this Organization. This enables data on funders and recipients to be linked up across different datasets. Org-id.guide links to a number of official registers that can be used to generate identifiers in a common way (e.g. using UK Company or Charity number). Alternatively, unique identifiers from the publisher's internal systems can be used.

title: Alternate Name
description: An alternative name for this Organization (e.g. trading name)

title: Charity Number
description: Registered charity number, if applicable.

title: Company Number
description: Registered UK company number, if applicable.

title: Street Address
description: Building number and street name.

title: City
description: City or town.

title: County
description: County

title: Country
description: Country

title: Postal Code
description: Postal code (please try and provide a post code whenever possible)

title: Department
description: The department or sub-unit of this Organization making or receiving the grant.

title: Contact Name
description: The contact person at this Organization.

title: Phone Number
description: Contact phone number.

title: Email
description: The email address for this Organization.

title: Description
description: A short description of this Organization and its area of work

title: Organization Type
description: A value from the Organization Type codelist describing the nature of this organization. Values should be from the organizationType codelist.
values: Enum: CIO - Charitable Incorporated Organisation, CLG - Company Limited by Guarantee, CLS - Company Limited by Shares, IPS - Industrial and Provident Society, LLP - Limited Liability Partnership, LA - Local Authority, CU - Mutual (Credit Union), FS - Mutual (Friendly Society), PLC - Public Listed Company, BENCOM - Registered Society (BenCom), COOP - Registered Society (Cooperative), UNINC - Unincorporated Organisation, OTH - Other

title: Industry classifications
description: This field may be used to provide a list (array) of industry classifications. SIC codes are preferred, but the user may need to check and identify which codes are in use.

title: Start date
description: When was this organisation established?

title: End date
description: When was this organisation dissolved? If the organization is still active this field should be blank.

title: Web Address
description: A web address for the organization

title: Location
description: Locations associated with the organization

title: Identifier
description: Location identifier

title: Name
description: A name for this location.

title: Description
description: A description of this location. This could include details of the element of the activity that takes place here.

title: Country Code
description: The ISO Country Code of the location of this activity.

title: Postcode
description: A postcode for this location.

title: Geographic Code
description: A code referring to a geographical area, drawn from an established gazetteer. For example, the code for a local authority ward, or parliamentary constituency.

title: Geographic Code Type
description: The type of Geographic Code (geoCode) used (e.g. Ward, Parliamentary Constituency etc.). This value for this field should be drawn from the codelist of geographic code types.

title: Latitude
description: The latitude of a point location

title: Longitude
description: The longitude of a point location

title: Last modified
description: The date and time when information about this Organization was last updated.

title: Last modified

title: Offers
description: An offer describes the opportunity for investors to join a particular deal by providing finance by purchasing shares, making loans or providing some other form of input described by the offer documents. Each deal may have one or more offers associated with it.

title: Offer
description: An offer describes the opportunity for investors to join a particular deal by providing finance by purchasing shares, making loans or providing some other form of input described by the offer documents.

title: Identifier
description: A unique identifier for this offer.

title: Type
description: What kind of offer is this. Open offers allow investment at any time. Time limited offers have a closing date, and may only be actioned if they hit their fund-raising targets during the offer period. Values must be from the offerType codelist.

title: Web page
description: A link to more details of this offer

title: Offer document URL
description: A link to the offer document.

title: Launch date
description: The launch date of the offer.

title: Closing date
description: The closing date of the offer.

title: Extension date
description: If an offer has been extended, the updated closing date should be provided here.

title: Minimum investment target
description: The minimum investment target. In many offers, if this is not reached, the offer will be cancelled.

title: Optimum investment target
description: The optimum investment target. This is the primary fundraising goal for the offer. If only one target is given, this should be used.

title: Maximum investment target
description: The maximum investment target. The offer may be closed when it reaches this target, or funds above this amount returned as the project would not be able to use them.

title: Individual investment: minimum
description: The minimum investment amount that an individual investor may provide in response to this offer.

title: Individual investment: maximum
description: The maximum investment amount that an individual investor may provide in response to this offer.

title: Investment features
description: Any notable features of the investment criteria, such as variable minimum for particular geographical areas, or use of a subscription model.

title: Interest rate
description: The interest rate specified in the offer.

title: Interest rate
description: An interest rate.

title: Base
description: If this interest rate is based on a formula with a base rate + a percentage (e.g. Bank of England rate + 35) then a codelist entry to describe the base rate is given here. Where no recognised codelist value exists, a short clear string should be used that can be easily interpreted by a data user to identify the base rate uses. Where this is no base rate, and the margin specifies the full exchange rate, base should be left blank. Values should be from the interestRate codelist, or may use a recognised interest rate code.

title: Margin
description: The rate of interest charged above the base rate, as a value between 0 and 1 (e.g. 1% - 0.01).

title: Effective rate
description: In cases where a variable base and margin are used, or where the interest payments have a complex profile (e.g. changing rates over the period of the investment; or effects of compound interest) then the effective rate should provide a figure that represents either (a) the value of the base and margin at the time of the offer; or (b) the average effective rate for the anticipated duration of an investment (Note: this is not the same as a Mortgage Effective Interest Rate).

title: Has added conditions?
description: If true, the payment of interest may be subject to certain conditions. The conditions may be described in the details.

title: Is variable?
description: If true, the rate of interest paid may vary based on time or performance of the related offer, deal or project. The rate recorded should be the initial anticipated rate. Any basis for variations may be explained in details.

title: Details
description: A description of the interest rate, and any specific conditions that apply, such as interest payment delays (e.g. interest is only paid from year 3 onwards), or other conditions on interest payments.

title: Match funding
description: If this offer has a match funding component, this is described here.

title: Required?
description: Is match funding required by this offer?

title: Status
description: Has match funding been applied for or secured? Values must be from the matchFundingStatus codelist.

title: Details
description: Details should be provided here of any match funding conditions for this offer, or any match funding secured.

title: Withdrawal
description: Can investors withdraw their investments? Each condition under which withdrawal can be made should be specified here.

title: Withdrawal conditions
description: A description of the conditions under which investment withdrawal may take place

title: Initial period
description: Where there is an initial period during which investment may not be withdrawn this should be given either as the anticipate date (YYYY-MM-DD) at which withdrawal will first be allowed, or as the period from the close of the deal using ISO 8601 duration format. For example, if capital cannot be widthdrawn for 3 years and 6 months, this field should contain '3Y6M'.

title: Description
description: A description of any conditions on withdrawal.

title: Capital limit
description: Details of any limit on the amount of capital that can be withdrawn. This field may currently be populated as a string, but a structured representation for this data may be identified in future.

title: Tax relief
description: Details of the tax relief available for this offer

title: Tax relief
description: A tax relief that may be applied to an offer or investment.

title: Type
description: A code describing the type of tax relief available. Values should be from the taxRelief codelist.
values: Enum: Other, SEIS, EIS, SITR, CITR

title: Status
description: The status of this tax relief. Values should be from the taxReliefStatus codelist.
values: Enum: advanceAssuranceAppliedFor, advanceAssuranceReceived, fullTaxReliefApproval, applicationRejected, notAppliedFor

title: CSU Standard Mark
description: The Community Shares Unit standard mark is awarded to offers that meet national standards of good practice in the UK. See https://communityshares.org.uk/standard-mark-0 for more details.

title: Awarded
description: Has this offer been awarded the CSU Standard Mark

title: Practitioner
description: The name of the practitioner involved in this CSU Standard Mark award.

title: Crowd funding
description: If this offer took place through a crowdfunding platform, details should be provided here.

title: Platform
description: The name of the platform the offer took place on

title: URL
description: The URL of the crowdfunding platform page for this offer.

title: Project
description: Projects associated with the deal.

title: Project
description: A project funded by a social investment

title: Title
description: The title of this project

title: Description
description: A description of this project

title: Status
description: What is the current status of this project when last updated. Values must be from the projectStatus codelist.

title: Start date
description: When was/is this project scheduled to start?

title: End date
description: When was/is this project scheduled to end?

title: Version date
description: If this project has been through a number of stages, iterations or phases, which 'edition' of the project does the information presented here represent? This should be indicated using a date. For example, if a particular project worked to raise capital to buy property in 2016, and then separately raised working capital from June 2018, there may be two project entries, one with `editionDate` of 2016-01-01, and the other with an `editionDate` of 2018-06-01

title: Estimated value
description: The overall estimated value of this edition of the project. Given in the default currency.

title: Project raised value
description: The total raised for this project. This may match the sum of the deal components related to this project, but may in some cases also include investments from across a range of deals where the project was funded through more than one deal. Given in the default currency.

title: Project achieved?
description: Did this edition of the project meet its stated goals? For example, successfully raising finance and purchasing the assets specified, or delivering the services in the description. Further information can be provided in in the notes field if required.

title: Classification
description: Project classification

title: Classification
description: A project classification.

title: Scheme
description: A code describing the classification scheme in use. Values should be from the classificationScheme codelist where applicable. Alternative codelist entries may be used by agreement between data publishers.

title: Code
description: A code from the classification scheme.

title: Title
description: The title or label used in the classification scheme.

title: Purpose of finance
description: A description of the role of finance in this project.

title: Purpose
description: The purpose(s) of this investment into the related organisation or project. Values must be from the investmentPurpose codelist.
values: Enum: acquisition, asset, bridgingLoan, capital, developmentCapital, growthFinance, multiple, property, propertyRefurbishment, other, restructuringFinance, startupCosts, workingCapital

title: Assets
description: If this project involves the purchase of assets details of those assets should be provided here.

title: Asset
description: An asset purchased as part of a project in receipt of investment.

title: Identifier
description: A unique identifier for this asset

title: Description
description: A short title or description of this asset

title: Type
description: The type of asset. Values must be from the assetType codelist.

title: Status
description: Is the purchase of these assets planned or completed? Values must be from the assetStatus codelist.

title: Quantity
description: What is the estimated or actual quantity of these assets to be purchased.

title: Purchase price
description: What was/is the purchase price of this/these assets? This must be given in the default currency of this deal.

title: Total value
description: What is the total value given to this/these asset(s)? This must be given in the default currency of this deal.

title: Valuation method
description: How has the value in 'total value' been arrived at? Values should be from the valuationMethod codelist.

title: Is this asset security?
description: Set to true if this asset is being used as security for some other component of a related deal.

title: Reference number(s)
description: One or more reference numbers for this asset. For example, the land registry title number in the case of property assets.

title: Location
description: Information on locations associated with the project.

title: Identifier
description: Location identifier

title: Name
description: A name for this location.

title: Description
description: A description of this location. This could include details of the element of the activity that takes place here.

title: Country Code
description: The ISO Country Code of the location of this activity.
values: Enum: AF, AX, AL, DZ, AS, AD, AO, AI, AQ, AG, AR, AM, AW, AU, AT, AZ, BS, BH, BD, BB, BY, BE, BZ, BJ, BM, BT, BO, BQ, BA, BW, BV, BR, IO, BN, BG, BF, BI, KH, CM, CA, CV, KY, CF, TD, CL, CN, CX, CC, CO, KM, CG, CD, CK, CR, CI, HR, CU, CW, CY, CZ, DK, DJ, DM, DO, EC, EG, SV, GQ, ER, EE, ET, FK, FO, FJ, FI, FR, GF, PF, TF, GA, GM, GE, DE, GH, GI, GR, GL, GD, GP, GU, GT, GG, GN, GW, GY, HT, HM, VA, HN, HK, HU, IS, IN, ID, IR, IQ, IE, IM, IL, IT, JM, JP, JE, JO, KZ, KE, KI, KP, KR, KW, KG, LA, LV, LB, LS, LR, LY, LI, LT, LU, MO, MK, MG, MW, MY, MV, ML, MT, MH, MQ, MR, MU, YT, MX, FM, MD, MC, MN, ME, MS, MA, MZ, MM, NA, NR, NP, NL, NC, NZ, NI, NE, NG, NU, NF, MP, NO, OM, PK, PW, PS, PA, PG, PY, PE, PH, PN, PL, PT, PR, QA, RE, RO, RU, RW, BL, SH, KN, LC, MF, PM, VC, WS, SM, ST, SA, SN, RS, SC, SL, SG, SX, SK, SI, SB, SO, ZA, GS, SS, ES, LK, SD, SR, SJ, SZ, SE, CH, SY, TW, TJ, TZ, TH, TL, TG, TK, TO, TT, TN, TR, TM, TC, TV, UG, UA, AE, GB, US, UM, UY, UZ, VU, VE, VN, VG, VI, WF, EH, YE, ZM, ZW

title: Geographic Code
description: A code referring to a geographical area, drawn from an established gazetteer. For example, the code for a local authority ward, or parliamentary constituency.

title: Geographic Code Type
description: The type of Geographic Code (geoCode) used (e.g. Ward, Parliamentary Constituency etc.). This value for this field should be drawn from the codelist of geographic code types.

title: Latitude
description: The latitude of a point location

title: Longitude
description: The longitude of a point location

title: Notes
description: Notes related to this project which cannot otherwise be captured as structured data may be entered here. Any information which can be provide using a structured data field MUST NOT be included in the notes, but should instead be represented as structured data.

title: Investments
description: The financial components of the deal.

title: Summary
description: A free text summary of the investment structure of this deal.

title: Grants
description: Grants made as part of the social investment deal.

title: Grant
description: A non-repayable award.

title: Identifier
description: A unique identifier for this grant.

title: Status
description: The status of this investment. Values should be from the investmentStatus codelist.
values: Enum: requested, offered, expected, confirmed, cancelled

title: Purpose
description: The purpose(s) of this investment into the related organisation or project. Values must be from the investmentPurpose codelist.
values: Enum: acquisition, asset, bridgingLoan, capital, developmentCapital, growthFinance, multiple, property, propertyRefurbishment, other, restructuringFinance, startupCosts, workingCapital

title: Description
description: A description of the purpose of this grant.

title: Date Offered
description: The date that the grant was offered.

title: Date Agreed
description: The date that the grant was agreed.

title: Currency
description: The ISO 4217 three-digit country code (e.g. GBP for £).

title: Amount requested
description: The total amount requested/applied for from this grant source.

title: Amount committed
description: The total committed value of this grant.

title: Amount disbursed
description: The total committed disbursed from this grant.

title: Funding Organization
description: Details of the organization making this grant.

Alternatively, unique identifiers from the publisher's internal systems can be used.

description: The latitude of a point location

title: Longitude
description: The longitude of a point location

title: Last modified
description: The date and time when information about this Organization was last updated.

title: Is match funding?
description: If true, this investment, or proportion of it, is counted towards certain match funding requirements of this deal. More details may be given in the notes.

title: Notes
description: Notes related to this deal which cannot otherwise be captured as structured data may be entered here. Any information which can be provide using a structured data field MUST NOT be included in the notes, but should instead be represented as structured data.

title: Equity Investments
description: Equity components of the social investment deal.

title: Equity
description: An equity investment.

title: Identifier
description: A unique identifier for this equity investment

title: Status
description: The status of this investment. Values should be from the investmentStatus codelist.
values: Enum: requested, offered, expected, confirmed, cancelled

title: Purpose
description: The purpose(s) of this investment into the related organisation or project. Values must be from the investmentPurpose codelist.
values: Enum: acquisition, asset, bridgingLoan, capital, developmentCapital, growthFinance, multiple, property, propertyRefurbishment, other, restructuringFinance, startupCosts, workingCapital

title: Description
description: A description of this equity investment

title: Type
description: Does this entry describe a single equity holding by an institutional investor, or one or more equity holdings from retail investors (usually individuals)? Values must be from the equityType codelist.

title: Platform
description: Was this equity raised through a particular platform. This may be lisetd using the format 'Online: {name}' or 'Offline: {name}' to indicate whether this was an Internet based platform or not. Where the platform name is not known, 'Online' or 'Offline' may be entered.

title: Number of investors
description: Where this entry represents the total equity held by more than one party, enter the number of investors the entry describes here. In other cases, enter 1.

title: Currency
description: The ISO 4217 three-digit country code (e.g. GBP for £).

title: Estimated value
description: The estimated value to be raised through this equity. This may be set out in offer documents as an optimum target, or may come from other sources. In general, an estimated value will be from before this equity investment was completed, with the actually agreed amount in the `value` field.

title: Date Offered
description: The date that the investment was offered.

title: Date Agreed
description: The date that the investment was agreed as part of the deal.

title: Value
description: The total value of the equity provided.

title: Share class
description: The class of shares provided in return for this investment

title: Share capital issued
description: The percentage of the share class issued in return for this investment. Expressed as a value between 0 and 1.

title: Share rights
description: The rights associated with this class of share.

title: Tax relief
description: Details of the tax relief available for this investment.

title: Tax relief
description: A tax relief that may be applied to an offer or investment.

title: Type
description: A code describing the type of tax relief available. Values should be from the taxRelief codelist.
values: Enum: Other, SEIS, EIS, SITR, CITR

title: Status
description: The status of this tax relief. Values should be from the taxReliefStatus codelist.
values: Enum: advanceAssuranceAppliedFor, advanceAssuranceReceived, fullTaxReliefApproval, applicationRejected, notAppliedFor

title: Funding Organization
description: The organization(s) providing this equity investment.

title: Name
description: Organization name

title: Identifier
description: A globally unique identifier for this Organization. This enables data on funders and recipients to be linked up across different datasets. Org-id.guide links to a number of official registers that can be used to generate identifiers in a common way (e.g. using UK Company or Charity number). Alternatively, unique identifiers from the publisher's internal systems can be used.

title: Alternate Name
description: An alternative name for this Organization (e.g. trading name)

title: Charity Number
description: Registered charity number, if applicable.

title: Company Number
description: Registered UK company number, if applicable.

title: Street Address
description: Building number and street name.

title: City
description: City or town.

title: County
description: County

title: Country
description: Country

title: Postal Code
description: Postal code (please try and provide a post code whenever possible)

title: Department
description: The department or sub-unit of this Organization making or receiving the grant.

title: Contact Name
description: The contact person at this Organization.

title: Phone Number
description: Contact phone number.

title: Email
description: The email address for this Organization.

title: Description
description: A short description of this Organization and its area of work

title: Organization Type
description: A value from the Organization Type codelist describing the nature of this organization. Values should be from the organizationType codelist.
values: Enum: CIO - Charitable Incorporated Organisation, CLG - Company Limited by Guarantee, CLS - Company Limited by Shares, IPS - Industrial and Provident Society, LLP - Limited Liability Partnership, LA - Local Authority, CU - Mutual (Credit Union), FS - Mutual (Friendly Society), PLC - Public Listed Company, BENCOM - Registered Society (BenCom), COOP - Registered Society (Cooperative), UNINC - Unincorporated Organisation, OTH - Other

title: Industry classifications
description: This field may be used to provide a list (array) of industry classifications. SIC codes are preferred, but the user may need to check and identify which codes are in use.

title: Start date
description: When was this organisation established?

title: End date
description: When was this organisation dissolved? If the organization is still active this field should be blank.

title: Web Address
description: A web address for the organization

title: Location
description: Locations associated with the organization

title: Identifier
description: Location identifier

title: Name
description: A name for this location.

title: Description
description: A description of this location. This could include details of the element of the activity that takes place here.

title: Country Code
description: The ISO Country Code of the location of this activity.

title: Postcode
description: A postcode for this location.

title: Geographic Code
description: A code referring to a geographical area, drawn from an established gazetteer. For example, the code for a local authority ward, or parliamentary constituency.

title: Geographic Code Type
description: The type of Geographic Code (geoCode) used (e.g. Ward, Parliamentary Constituency etc.). This value for this field should be drawn from the codelist of geographic code types.

title: Latitude
description: The latitude of a point location

title: Longitude
description: The longitude of a point location

title: Last modified
description: The date and time when information about this Organization was last updated.

title: Fund
description: The fund that the investment forms a part of.

title: Fund
description: Investments and grants are often made from specific funding schemes. This provides space to detail the particular funding scheme with which finance is associated.

title: Code
description: An identifier for this fund.

title: Title
description: The title of this fund.

title: Description
description: A description of this fund.

title: URL
description: A web link to more details of this fund.

title: Last modified
description: The date and time when information about this fund was last updated.

title: Is match funding?
description: If true, this investment, or proportion of it, is counted towards certain match funding requirements of this deal. More details may be given in the notes.

title: Notes
description: Notes related to this deal which cannot otherwise be captured as structured data may be entered here. Any information which can be provide using a structured data field MUST NOT be included in the notes, but should instead be represented as structured data.

title: Credit Investments
description: Loan, bonds and leasing components of the social investment deal.

title: Loan/credit
description: Credit or loan based financing.

title: Identifier
description: A unique identifier for this loan

title: Status
description: The status of this investment. Values should be from the investmentStatus codelist.
values: Enum: requested, offered, expected, confirmed, cancelled

title: Purpose
description: The purpose(s) of this investment into the related organisation or project. Values must be from the investmentPurpose codelist.
values: Enum: acquisition, asset, bridgingLoan, capital, developmentCapital, growthFinance, multiple, property, propertyRefurbishment, other, restructuringFinance, startupCosts, workingCapital

title: description*
description: A description of this loan/credit funding

title: Currency
description: The ISO 4217 three-digit country code (e.g. GBP for £).

title: Estimated value
description: The estimated value to be raised through this credit or loan. This may come from an offer document, or from other sources. Once credit is confirmed, the actual amount should be recorded in the `value` field.

title: Date Offered
description: The date that the loan was offered.

title: Date Agreed
description: The date that the loan was agreed as part of the Deal.

title: Value
description: The total value of the credit or loan provided.

title: Term (months)
description: The term of this credit/loan in months

title: Initial repayment holiday (months)
description: If this loan or credit comes with an initial repayment holiday, enter the period in months here

title: Interest rate
description: The interest rate.

title: Interest rate
description: An interest rate.

title: Base
description: If this interest rate is based on a formula with a base rate + a percentage (e.g. Bank of England rate + 35) then a codelist entry to describe the base rate is given here. Where no recognised codelist value exists, a short clear string should be used that can be easily interpreted by a data user to identify the base rate uses. Where this is no base rate, and the margin specifies the full exchange rate, base should be left blank. Values should be from the interestRate codelist, or may use a recognised interest rate code.

title: Margin
description: The rate of interest charged above the base rate, as a value between 0 and 1 (e.g. 1% - 0.01).

title: Effective rate
description: In cases where a variable base and margin are used, or where the interest payments have a complex profile (e.g. changing rates over the period of the investment; or effects of compound interest) then the effective rate should provide a figure that represents either (a) the value of the base and margin at the time of the offer; or (b) the average effective rate for the anticipated duration of an investment (Note: this is not the same as a Mortgage Effective Interest Rate).

title: Has added conditions?
description: If true, the payment of interest may be subject to certain conditions. The conditions may be described in the details.

title: Is variable?
description: If true, the rate of interest paid may vary based on time or performance of the related offer, deal or project. The rate recorded should be the initial anticipated rate. Any basis for variations may be explained in details.

title: Details
description: A description of the interest rate, and any specific conditions that apply, such as interest payment delays (e.g. interest is only paid from year 3 onwards), or other conditions on interest payments.

title: Interest payable
description: The total interest payable over the duration of the credit/loan.

title: Funding Organization
description: Organization providing this credit or loan.

title: Name
description: Organization name

title: Identifier
description: A globally unique identifier for this Organization. This enables data on funders and recipients to be linked up across different datasets. Org-id.guide links to a number of official registers that can be used to generate identifiers in a common way (e.g. using UK Company or Charity number). Alternatively, unique identifiers from the publisher's internal systems can be used.
